content.webTitle: Badly burned body found in woodland

fields.headline: Badly burned body found in woodland
fields.bodyText: A police investigation has been launched after the discovery of a man's badly burned body on an area of woodland on the outskirts of Manchester. Extra patrols have been deployed after officers were called to the wooded area behind Pennington Road in Leigh, Greater Manchester, shortly before 3pm on Monday. A postmortem is due to take place to establish the cause of death and police are working to find the out the victim's identity. The body is reported to have been found by a passerby and had extensive burns all over. Detective Superintendent Jen Williams said: "Firstly, I want to stress that we are at the early stages of our inquiries. "A team of detectives is now working to establish the identity of the man and investigate the full circumstances that led to his death. "I know that residents will be alarmed by this incident, but I want to reassure the community that a thorough investigation is now taking place and there are extra patrols in the area. "I would urge anyone who has information that can assist our inquiries to call us as soon as possible." • Members of the public with information have been asked to call police on 101 or the independent charity Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.
